messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tatsutoshi
messages.msgSnippet: Cheers Lou, thanks for that. Rich ... From: JapaneseSwords@aol.com To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Saturday, December 20, 2003 4:08 AM Subject: Re:
messages.messageBody:
Cheers Lou, thanks for that.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: JapaneseSwords@...
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, December 20, 2003 4:08 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tatsutoshi


Rich,
Ignore that last one I found your smith. TATSUTOSHI aka MITSUTOSHI
F: Ito
W: Kofu ju, Omi Province
D: ca. 1800
NTS: Son of Yasutoshi

Worked in the same area at the same time as Tadayoshi, I wonder if they ever
met. Hope this helps.

Lou

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tatsutoshi
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, I don t know if this will help but here it goes.  Akasaka TADAYOSHI, Kofu ju, Omi Province, ca. 1800-25  He worked in the Akasaka style.  Maybe
messages.messageBody:
Rich,
I don't know if this will help but here it goes. Akasaka TADAYOSHI, Kofu
ju, Omi Province, ca. 1800-25 He worked in the Akasaka style. Maybe
Tatsutoshi is a student or another Akasaka smith that worked alongside Tadayoshi at
that time frame in this area. I know you seem to like Akasaka tsuba, is this
piece Akasaka in style? Do you think you could post a picture? I checked all
my books and could not find your smith directly, but this TADAYOSHI might be a
step in the right direction.

Lou


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
